name: Bali Women's Underwire, One Smooth U Ultra Light T-shirt, Convertible Bra

title: Buy these!
content: I have been on a new bra hunt. Several months ago I decided that the underwire had to go and sort of successfully found some that work-BUT they  are still poking me under the arms with a piece of plastic.  My husband inadvertently put my underwire bras in the dryer and now all have bent hooks, so it's time for new ones.  We have 1 Kohl's store locally and nothing else, so finding  a selection is limited. Back to Amazon.  I started reading reviews and looking at how many were purchased, etc.  I have worn Bali bras before and know that they seem to hold up well and fit me. My only problem with this is the "modesty layer", I am a 40DD and have NEVER had any kind of padding-why do bra companies do this? I don't want or need it.  But, in reading the reviews, many talked about how thin this was and especially how comfortable these bras are.  So-my thought, "I'll order one and try it and return it if I don't like it".  Well, I don't like it, I LOVE it! This is by far the most comfortable bra I have ever worn. It definitely is true to size and I don't mind or notice the "layer".  Most importantly, NO POKING, especially under the arms!  I can come home and take it off and not have red marks on my body.  It is soft, cool, not overly tight (but still supportive) and looks pretty.  I love the upper mesh part on these.  I do have one comment as several others mentioned, the fabric on the hook part is a little scratchy but only when putting it on.  I am a "spinner"-I cannot reach behind me to hook the bra, I have to hook in front and spin around my body (yeah, not good, I know), and it's a little scratchy when doing that, but once on, it's fine.  I have now purchased 4 of these in various colors and am hopeful that they will hold up.  These are convertible straps (I may never use that feature) and as others have posted, the strap adjustment is in the back.  No problem, adjust once and that's fine.  I also noticed while trying on non-underwire bras that many had very short straps-I am 5'2" and frequently have to shorten them a lot.  Many of the non underwire ones had very short straps that I still had to shorten.  These do not, they are more "normal" in length.  The price was great too, as the retail is $48 on these (why are bras so ridiculously expensive???). At $23, I feel like I can purchase several.  I am QUITE pleased with this and would highly recommend!
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on September 6, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: Okay, so I have a LOT to say about this bra. I'm sure you're reading the 1 and 2 star reviews and wondering whether you should take a chance. YES, by all means, do! I am going to do my best to address the issues raised in the low ratings. But first, please know that I have been wearing the bra for two days now (all day) and can tell you without reservation that it is one of the most - if not THE most - comfortable and attractive bras I've ever owned. I am rather chesty (a 38D) and usually have to try many bras on before I find an acceptable one, and then I buy like 3 or 4 at a time. I've worn Bali (though, not a ton of styles), Warner, Soma and others that perhaps I've long forgotten.  TAKE A LOOK AT MY PHOTOS and keep in mind that I am approaching my 64th birthday.  So, needless to say, the girls are not naturally perky at this stage in my life.  LOL.  I included one clothed so that you can see how it looks underneath a summer top.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on June 29, 2024

title: BUY. THIS. BRA.
content: So, as to the issue of fit:  It fits VERY true to size.  The cup size fits exactly like a D-cup should fit - no gaps, full coverage, no side spillage out of the cups.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on August 28, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: Underwire:  Truly, I have no idea what the complaints are all about.  There is more than adequate fabric covering the underwire, and it is very comfortable too.  If people are experiencing bruising (really???) or marks, perhaps they have it on hooks that are tighter than required, or maybe they need to go up to the next numeric size (e.g., 36 to 38).  As I said, I've been wearing this bra all day long for two days, and it doesn't even feel like I have it on - it's THAT comfortable.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on August 6, 2024

title: My favorite bra but‚Ä¶
content: Straps:  They adjust well and give a good range for just about any body.  I found that the girls are not sagging and are well supported. Sure, it would be easier to have them adjust in the front instead of the back, but once you make your adjustment, it's not like you have to do it every day (unless you're switching back and forth between racer-back and standard).  BTW, I am wearing it as a racer back today, and it's fabulous!
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on October 8, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: Padding:  Unless you have literal bullets for nipples, there is no way they're gonna poke through the padding.  The cups are not overly padded, which is really nice IMO, because too many bras have quite heavy padding, which is hot and uncomfortable and makes your chest look fake.

title: Very flattering
content: Embellishment:  The mesh portion on the upper cups is really attractive and lies perfectly.  I haven't found issues with gapping, unevenness or seams showing through the clothing.  I suppose if you wore a really tight top that is maybe silk or satin, you might see something.  But for everyday use, the seam is it is not an issue.

title: Verified Purchase
content: I was very happy with this bra. It fits well and is super comfortable in, always except one. I now use a cloth type Band-Aid to put on the bra that sits against my skin and that works, but it looks tacky. I like the bra so much that I bought a second one, hoping that it would not have the same discomfort. Unfortunately, it‚Äôs the exact same discomfort . So I just keep an extra batch of Band-Aids in my underwear drawer.

title: Nice bra, fold lines in cups
content: This is a very nice bra. I wear 38C or 38D in Warners, and I thought maybe Bali was smaller in the band and bigger in the cups. I think it is slightly bigger in the cups, because I would be swimming in a D in this, but I don't think the band is much smaller, since the 40 band is quite large. The C cup it lots large. I probably could have ordered a 38C as recommended, and been fine. The bra is pretty on, and I like the cut of it. The only issue is there are fold lines in the (albeit thin) foam lining. I hope they will come out in the wash, but I'm not so sure. It looks like the cups were damaged in shipping. I might have tried to return this for a smaller size and hopefully line-free cups if I didn't live overseas, but the shipping to return it and get another one back would cost more than the bra!
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on September 23, 2024

title: Ladies THIS is the fit!

I remember this brand from so long ago how did we get distracted away from a natural looking bust line and comfortable to boot? Never again. This bra comes in a lot of pretty colors also so do yourself a favor if you‚Äôre tired of getting stabbed in the side by your underwire and give this bra a try. title: Verified Purchase

Needless to say, I needed to order more and replace my current bra wardrobe and I ordered the exact same Bali bra a few months ago and there was something off on the sewing that it itched and dug into my skin. I don't like other bras so I was hoping it was a manufacturing defect and took my chances and ordered another. After a few days of wearing, thankful my comfortable Bali bra without defects is back! title: Love the fit but‚Ä¶.
content: Y'all... I'm shocked. I am so picky about bras. I hate torpedo boobs which I feel like always happens when I buy bras online. You know what I mean, when the bra cup cones out. It's just a personal preference, no hate. But these bras... chefs kiss. They don't cut me anywhere, everything feels secure, my rolls aren't rolling and I'm not adjusting every few minutes. You can't feel the under wire either. The only thing I would like more of in this bra is lift. I'm old, chubby and have had 2 kids who slowly have drained the life outta me so the girls are sad but it's not enough to deter me. Just buy it. Also, follow the size chart. I questioned it so I bought the size I thought and the size the chart said and the chart won.

title: Very nice fit
content: Always looking for the most cooling bras to get me through the hottest, sweatiest months of our work season.  Tried this style and was shockingly surprised to find it is THE COOLEST BRA EVER for working outdoors in sweltering weather, and I've tried all kinds.  The fit is flexible and comfortable, with the stretchy mesh edging conforming to my every move, no spilling out when I bend forward.  The underwires are so much cooler against the skin than the big elastic bands of so-called wicking, cooling sports bras.  Thin cup material is def cooling, but you do lose a bit of the "modesty" protection of traditionally thicker foam cups.  Whatever!  I just want to be cool and dry!  I wear it under printed cotton blouses for work, so if anyone notices any headlight action, they're looking way too closely!

title: Good bra
content: I was so excited for this bra, however I ordered the wrong size. I believe I went too big. It ended up rubbing up against my low sternum and created really red, irritated marks. I would order again and try another size. I typically wear a 40D and ended up ordering a sister size instead (38 DD) which has never been a problem before. But I is my fault. The bra itself was very nice, the fabric was very breathable.
